thread.title: H.S. girls Athlete of the Week: Ramsey's Kassidy Shetler - Athlete of the Week
thread.title_full: H.S. girls Athlete of the Week: Ramsey's Kassidy Shetler - Athlete of the Week - NorthJersey.com

author: CHUCK O'DONNELL
title: H.S. girls Athlete of the Week: Ramsey's Kassidy Shetler - Athlete of the Week
text:
Kassidy Shetler doesn't get much free time between field hockey and school work, but when the Ramsey junior wants to relax, food is usually involved.
She has to admit, however, she's still trying to master the finer points of cooking.
On Saturday night, she made a batch of cut-and-bake chocolate chip cookies.
Other times, she heats up her specialty, noodles with butter.
"I love food and I want to know how to cook, I just don't know how to yet," Shetler said, laughing.
The Record Female Athlete of the Week whipped up another heaping serving of offense last week.
The left inner had five goals and four assists in victories over Hackensack, Lakeland and Pompton Lakes.
Including the hat trick against Pompton Lakes, Shetler finished the week with 24 goals and 12 assists on the season as the Rams stretched their record to 12-0.
She said part of the team's success can be traced back to, what else, food.
The players have bonded over many meals. Shetler suspects there's a correlation between their friendships off the field and communication on it.
"We work really well together," she said.
"We all know how each other plays and we give really good passes."
Shetler has already committed to play at Rutgers.
She said she clicked with the players during her visits, and the coaches make sure everyone gets some playing time.
As for what she'll study, well, that may all come back to food.
"I think I'm going to go in undecided," Shetler said. "If I don't find anything that interests me, I want to go into their business school and then after college, I want to go to culinary school and learn how to cook."
Also nominated: Lauren Dickerson of Holy Angels, Veronica Corcoran of NV/Demarest and Jessica Rogers of Rutherford for volleyball, Mia Luna of Lyndhurst for soccer and Rhiannon Novelli of Holy Angels for cross-country.
